## Plan Your Visit

### We're always free + open to all.

Bringing a group of 10 people or more? Simplify your check-in experience by using our [Group Visit Bookings](https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/BookingsBroadArtMuseum@michiganstate.onmicrosoft.com/bookings/) page to register in advance.

admission_text:
# Plan Your Visit

## Plan Your Visit

### We're always free + open to all.

Bringing a group of 10 people or more? Simplify your check-in experience by using our [Group Visit Bookings](https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/BookingsBroadArtMuseum@michiganstate.onmicrosoft.com/bookings/) page to register in advance.

## Regular Hours:

**Monday:** Closed  
**Tuesday:** Closed  
**Wednesday:** 10am–6pm  
**Thursday:** 10am–6pm  
**Friday:** 10am–6pm  
**Saturday:** 10am–6pm  
**Sunday:** 10am–6pm

## Special Hours:

**Dec. 12, 2025:** Open 10am–4pm

**Dec. 15, 2025–Jan. 9, 2026:** Closed

## House Rules

### TAKE SOME PICS

Take photos for personal use!  
But please, no flash.

### CHECK YOURSELF

Check your bags and other items that may harm the art before entering the galleries.

### USE PENCILS

Pens, paint, wet media, and other items that could damage artwork are not allowed in the galleries.

### ASK QUESTIONS

We’re here to help! Reach us at [eebam@msu.edu](mailto:msubam@msu.edu) or find a gallery guide to learn more.

### ENJOY A SNACK

Have a snack in our Education Wing or outside in the courtyard. Eating and drinking is not permitted in the galleries.

### HAVE A CHAT

Conversations about what you see, think, and wonder are encouraged!

### KEEP A SAFE DISTANCE

Help us protect the art by not touching it.

### TREAT YOURSELF

Take home a gift for you or a friend! All proceeds directly support the MSU Broad Art Museum and our programming.

accessibility_text:
[**Michigan State University**](/) >

Digital Accessibility

# Digital Accessibility

Michigan State University is committed to providing equitable access to university programs, services and information while enhancing inclusion for the broadest possible audience.

The [MSU Digital Accessibility Policy](https://webaccess.msu.edu/policy) reflects MSU’s aspiration and intent to live the university’s core values of collaboration, equity, excellence, integrity and respect, and the university’s commitment to eliminate barriers to access, challenge discrimination and bias, and address past and present inequalities.

The Digital Accessibility Policy defines the accessibility requirements for university websites and web-delivered content. The [Technical Guidelines](https://webaccess.msu.edu/policy/technical-guidelines) define the required version of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).

Content that Michigan State University has created that is not fully accessible to individuals with disabilities can be reported to the Digital Accessibility Team through the [inaccessible digital content report form](https://go.msu.edu/digitalaccessibility).

Reports can be made anonymously or with an email and/or MSU NetID attached. Reports that include contact information may be easier for the Digital Accessibility Team to follow up on.

University policy prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals with disabilities. Reports of disability discrimination may be filed online v...
